elements.name: disclaimer
elements.title:
"Choose how to attend your Traffic Hearing" is a service provided by the Government of British Columbia.

The Government of British Columbia has the right to change this service at any time.
  • Learn more about the disclaimer and liability here. (This link opens in a new tab)
  • Learn more about privacy and security here. (This link opens in a new tab)
The Provincial Court of British Columbia will look at your choice to decide how you will attend your Traffic Hearing.

By pressing "Continue," you are agreeing to these terms.

elements.name: noDisputeNoMoreTimeExplanation
elements.title:
You do not need to continue on with this service.

Please check your Violation Ticket for instructions on how to pay your fine.

If you do not pay your fine, the Court will schedule an In-Person Traffic hearing and send you a "Notice of Hearing."

elements.name: disputeType
elements.title: Are you `disputing the allegation` or `disputing the fine amount`
elements.description:
Disputing the allegation means you are saying that you did NOT commit the offence described on your Violation Ticket. This will require a Traffic Hearing.
Disputing the fine amount means you are saying that you did commit the offence described on your Violation Ticket and you want to reduce the fine. This does not necessarily require a Traffic Hearing.

choices.text: I did NOT commit the offence and I am disputing the ticket (the allegation)
I did commit the offence but I am asking for a reduced fine

elements.name: disputeTypeFineAmountExplanation
elements.title:
Did you know?
You can ask to reduce the fine in writing instead of attending a Traffic hearing.
You can also ask for more time to pay the fine in writing instead of attending a Traffic hearing.

elements.name: witnessesFAQ
elements.title: How do I prepare my witnesses for my Traffic Hearing?
elements.body:
You will need to provide your witnesses with documents related to your Traffic Hearing before it starts.

The Court will administer the oath or affirmation for each witness. If your witness wants to swear an oath on a religious text, you must make sure they have the religious text they want before your Traffic Hearing starts.

elements.name: witnessesAmount
elements.title: How many Witnesses do you plan on asking to attend your Traffic Hearing?

elements.name: exhibits
elements.title: Will you be bringing Exhibits to your Traffic Hearing?
elements.description: Examples of Exhibits are a doctor's note, police report, photograph, video (dash cam), or other documents.

elements.name: exhibitsFAQ
elements.title: Can I show Exhibits by video?
elements.body:
You can share your screen using Microsoft Teams to show documents during your Traffic Hearing. You may only share your screen if directed to do so by the Court.

You will get instructions on how to share you screen.

If you have a large number of documents to show during your Traffic Hearing, you may provide advance copies to the Court by email.

Please contact the Violation Ticket Centre at 1-877-661-8026 for more information.
